content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
No new structures have been successfully placed on the map. The agent repeatedly attempted to produce and place a Lab at (0.5, 2.5) for supplying Automation Science Packs to research, but all Lab-related operations failed due to resource shortages and inventory issues. In addition, while two processing units were referenced during smelting operations, they are pre‐existing entities rather than agent‐constructed structures:
• Iron Smelting Furnace at Position(5.0, 5.0) – used for converting iron ore (with coal) into iron plates.
• Copper Smelting Furnace at Position(–27.0, –60.0) – used for converting copper ore (with coal) into copper plates.
These processing units support resource production but do not represent structures built by the agent.

ERROR TIPS
• API Usage for Entity Retrieval
  – When calling get_entities, use the exact API signature. Avoid passing keyword arguments (such as “radius”) or extraneous positional arguments if the function does not require them.
• Validation of Retrieved Entities
  – Confirm that the output from retrieval calls is iterable before processing. This prevents errors like attempting to iterate over a NoneType.
• Lab Placement and Crafting
  – Before attempting placement, verify that the Lab item exists in the inventory.
  – Check that all required resources and sub-ingredients (for example, iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables) are available to satisfy the Lab crafting recipe.
  – Review and validate recipe dependencies and resource availability to avoid crafting failures due to missing components.
• Consistent Inventory Checks
  – Regularly ensure that the resource counts match the requirements for crafting operations so that operations are not initiated when ingredients are insufficient.
